intro: Chrysosplenium sikangense, commonly known as the Sichuan chrysosplenium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, often arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
